Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel4you
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in San Diego near all of the attractions. Great for a weekend get away. Hawaiian decor makes you think your in the islands, not the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, economical alternative to downtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: SoItinerant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the CP rather by accident, because we failed to book three rooms at a downtown hotel so that we could attend a large scientific meeting. Faced with room charges well north of $300 apiece, we cast our net wider and recalled seeing a Crowne Plaza in Mission Valley near another popular meeting site. We got three rooms for about a third of the downtown cost, with a continental breakfast thrown in, plus, on weekdays, free drinks, in the Priority Club lounge. (We didn't take advantage of these because we usually stayed downtown until late.) The property is rather senior but well maintained, with a Hawaiian theme that is relatively tastefully executed. The bar has a happy hour in the evenings M-F and a curious 10 pm to midnight one seven days a week, and serves good sushi (the salmon sashimi, which I tried, was very good, and generously supplied). The free breakfast is adequate, with an unusually good selection of fruit. On two mornings the straight coffee ran out, leaving us with only a rather icky flavored coffee; this would be easy to avoid. We used the restaurant once and found the food to be average, with no healthy choices available, as is all too common. The rooms were large and nicely furnished, with a nice view over the courtyard and pool. Free Internet is available via a pass code supplied at check-in, which makes me wonder whether it is always free. I did not use it, depending on my rooted Android's hotspot instead. We stayed on the eighth floor, which we were amused to see was a "quiet zone" where a sign informed us that tour groups and circus animals were not allowed. Nice touch, and appreciated. Downtown is very easy to get to. Simply take the 8 west then the 5 south to Front street. With light traffic it takes about ten minutes. All told, a pleasant, drama-free stay. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Grace F
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable time here. Our room was clean, comfortable and attractive. The pool area was very attractive with lots of lounges and trees. The on site restaurant served a variety of delicious foods at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Older, well maintained, clean and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Sean D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times for business and a few times for vacation. This is an older property but still well maintained with a great courtyard and a golf course on the other side. The restaurant has good seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, pleasant staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: gvwatts
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza as part of a group that was getting together for a small convention which included a reception in one of the hotel's meeting rooms. All in all, we got very good value from this property. Decent restaurant service, adequate housekeeping, and staff who were eager to please. Rooms were adequately furnished although they could use an upgrade. One of the interesting features which guests may find either great or annoying are the hotel's "green" efforts at saving on electricity in the bathrooms. Our bathroom had motion activated lights which were set to stay on for a specified length of time. The annoying part comes in when a guest needs the lights to stay on for a longer period (lights going off while one is in the shower); the other annoying part could be when a guest has to go in the middle of the night and the bathroom lights go on whether you want them to or not. My suggestion would be to provide something that would allow guests to "override" the standard settings. Something else that we did not find too pleasant were the daily charges for internet use. I guess we're spoiled by free wi-fi offered by many hotels and we were not too willing to pay the $9.95 per day charged by the Crowne Plaza, but we did anyway because we wanted the connectivity. The hotel service for our group reception was outstanding. We had a good size room and they provided whatever we needed for our event. The appetizer and dessert buffet provided good variety and excellent quality. We want to give special thanks to Anna for arranging our room block and to Steve for finalizing our reception and food requirements.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego CP”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer V
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Crown Plaza April 1-4 2012. We really enjoyed our stay. It is a short drive to Sea World, the Zoo and local beaches. The Hotel was clean and the beautiful. Although the pool was "heated" it was not heated to a temperture that was comfortable to be in...Nice hot tub. Loved San Diego and this was a great place to hang out at night.

Reviews.Title: “A little run down, but still nice”
Reviews.Author: Melly44
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of nice features including two restaurants, a beautiful courtyard with waterfalls and greenery, a pool, laundry facilities, and a shuttle to the zoo, etc. The best part of the hotel is the sushi restaurant - great sushi and plenty of fun tropical drinks to choose from. However, the hotel is in need of some updates as some things didn't work, or only half worked - only on elevator worked, the change machine was broken, only one key worked, some lights in our room wouldn't turn off, and on of our sink taps were put on backwards. Overall they were small issues, but when your paying $100+ a night you expect most things to work correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Georgia924
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware!!! There are plenty of other hotels in the area. My advice is to not stay here! The entire place needs serious updating. Our room was adjacent to the pool and elevator therefore we had everyone go by our room at all hours of the night. The room had a musty/mildew odor that was covered up by some sort of nauseating airfreshner. We felt like we were in a dingy basement room . Horrible. Also no complimentary coffee, wifi or parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Zorro98
Reviews.Content: It's clean, has a good location and the staff are friendly. The rooms are nice, well kept if a little dated. I stayed there because I got a great week end deal.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Laurie C
Reviews.Content: I had a great two-night stay at this hotel. It began with fabulous front-desk service from a bright and pleasant young man named Nathen Teller and ended with a good-natured parking attendant who remembered me from the day before and waved me through. Where else do you get such friendly and personalized service at a such a large and busy hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovating”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: Overall not bad but the rooms are old and the elevators are slow. Very large property with nice landscaping. Check in went fast. Nice and safe for family's. Slept well and the place is nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay - nothing earth shattering”
Reviews.Author: Fotomate
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip over the past three days. The hotel is conveniently located to most points of interest in San Diego, there are a lot of places to eat and shop nearby as well. Old Town is fairly close. My stay at the hotel for the most part was pleasant and uneventful. The hotel appears to be somewhat older and in need of a makeover. It was clean, I just didn't care for the decor in the rooms. The hotel has a nice outdoor pool but when I stayed there the water was not heated. The outdoor jacuzzi/spa nearby was nice and big and the jets worked without any problems. Although the gym had just about any cardio piece of equipment you would expect to find in a gym, including free weights, it just seemed sort of dull and tired and not a place where you would enjoy staying for a while to break a sweat. There were a few occasions where I noticed that the meals from room service have been left by the room door for staff to pick up and some of the plates remained in front of the room for an entire day which leads me to believe that the staffing may be a little low. The store/gift shop seemingly had no set hours of operation and for the most part it was hit or miss on when you could go in to grab a snack or whatever. The breakfast if you were an "Aloha member" was complimentary and it was quite decent with everything you would imagine for breakfast available. The rooms as I mentioned need an update although the TV's are flat screen which was nice as was the balcony which you access through a large sliding door. The bathrooms were okay but don't expect to be able to stand under the shower head in the tub unless you are 4 feet tall as the shower head is mounted low on the wall and that is mostly due to the "drop ceiling" over the bathtub. The front desk staff was courteous and my room was made up each of the three days I was there. Overall, the stay was good, price wasn't bad and the location was convenient, the hotel just needs a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service at front desk, Christine”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: Christine was a breath of fresh air after a long day of travel and work. She is a good reason why I have been staying more and more at Crown Plaza. I am sure that great things lay ahead for this bright rep of yours and I hope that it will be with Crown Plaza for a long time to come. Christine at the front desk Sincerely, Chris Harrison

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dcilliers
Reviews.Content: We won this on Superbowl Sunday for $56 on Hotwire (3 star Mission Valley) and were very pleased to be at the Crowne Plaza Hanalei. Service was excellent from everyone we encountered. I called to request a fridge and microwave and it was done with no problem (the top two floors have fridge and microwave, the others do not.) Check in was very friendly. In the morning we wanted more coffee and also a bowl and spoon to make oatmeal for our 2 year old son. The housekeeper that answered (I believe her name was Inez) was not only extremely nice and professional, she even called back to be sure we received what we needed, which we had within minutes of asking. We were really impressed. The room was clean and beds were comfortable. We did not walk around the property, but could see the interior from our room and balcony, and it looked quite pretty - nice pool and a fair amount of grass and landscaping. The location is very convenient - it is next to the golf course, a couple of minutes to Fashion Valley Mall and a very short drive to anywhere in central San Diego including Old Town, Downtown, Mission Bay and the beaches. Overall we were very pleased. One suggestion to the hotel: the single cup coffee pots are very convenient, but if there are two adults in the room and one does not drink decaf, you have to call housekeeping for more regular coffee (or vice versa if both drink decaf) - suggest two of each coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Essentially just fine”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingnewyorker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night on business and attended a meeting in their function room. There is definitely a 1960s vibe to the place. Public spaces could definitely use and upgrade. My room was fine--exactly what you'd expect--clean and spacious. The pool area was very pleasant. The food was surprisingly good. I ate lunch there at the restaurant and it was very good value. The breakfast buffet was very good. I was attending a function and I have to say that the luncheon provided was way above the level you would normally expect at a corporate event.

Reviews.Title: “”
Reviews.Author: mialyn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel a couple times, my family and I liked the environment and room. The receptionist staff were very friendly and welcoming. I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Angela J
Reviews.Content: I have been in the hospitality business for over 12 years. So I'm very critical when I visit and my expectations are high. I salute your staff for their outstanding professionalism and pleasant demenors. In particular Nate Tellers, Trisha Tiapale, Adam Foster and Yesenia Hernandez. These four individuals assisted me with enthusiasium and greeted me with a smile. They went the extra mile to assist me. I was delightfully surprised. Way to go training team! -Angela

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing break”
Reviews.Author: MNN1807
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay for us (family leisure break). The service was very attentive and rooms clean and soundproof. Very attentive staff in a hotel with good facilities. We needed a car as the location is away from major centres - however the hotel has shuttle buses which are very flexible too.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average”
Reviews.Author: SPXW_CL_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week in May of 2011. Close to the highway and even though it was on the edge of the city it was an easy commute to down town. Rooms were well above average and very clean. WiFi was fast and reliable though pricey, asked for and received coupon for free, otherwise expensive. Parking is also expensive but again got "free" coupon so that wasn't too bad.

Reviews.Title: “a total letdown”
Reviews.Author: Vegasvet
Reviews.Content: I post this review again as it's obvious that somehow the hotel management managed to have it cancelled by Tripadvisor staff. The hotel is old and dingy,the rate on the iPhone app was $109 including wifi and parking but when we arrived the rate was $119 per night plus $12 per night for the parking and $9 for internet wifi. Clean rooms but way too dated. Public areas are clean but at this stage of worn it's very hard to make them look pleasant. Worst thing ever the breakfast buffet in their Lanai-something dining room. Obviously this room never saw a renovation in years and I'm ok with that,but food was very old and greasy,really not acceptable. We were supposed to stay 3 nights but we left after the first night. If this review will be cancelled again I'm gonna take actions against Tripadvisor and the Crowne Plaza Hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: europe_tour05
Reviews.Content: I booked the room for my family and relatives to stay during our US trip. Since it was our last night in US before flying off, thought should just splurge for a little luxury. Got a very good rate coz book early, but the room turned out to be quite tight and small. Maybe because the furniture in there were too much and bulky for a room with 2 queen bed + 1 rollaway bed. The location was very convenient, shopping area was just 5 minutes drive behind the hotel, and Old Town was just across the highway. Having to pay for parking is not cool, especially coz when we stayed at other cheaper hotels in US, no need to pay parking. Also, no free breakfast.. ;( Overall..an ok stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great quick stop in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: 60-degreese-North
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night after a long transatlantic flight - although organised by BA, this was some distance from the airport and not near anywhere that can be walked to... However, the rooms were excellent, the staff were chirpy and welcoming. We crashed out and in the morning had the breakfast buffet - we were in late and although the service was excellent the hot food was "tired" and uninspiring and the porridge (US = oatmeal) was really disgusting. Reception staffb were lovely. Would stay here again - but would avoid the hote breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay”
Reviews.Author: winko c
Reviews.Content: We brought kids over to visit SeaWorld and Zoo, had a very good time. The hotel is not new, but keeping its Crowne Plaza status very well （I stay with the chain quite a bit). Nice tropical setting. Kids enjoy playing in pools. Wife left her coat behind, didn't notice that until we returned to Canada. Hotel's housekeeping department is very responsive, mail us back the coat in days. Will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A Very San Diego New Year”
Reviews.Author: bannvaldez
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, I stayed here for New Years Eve and day. The place was gorgeous, clean and everyone was so nice. We spent most of our night at the hotel Sushi Bar, where the service was fantastic and the sushi delicious!!! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely time and very much enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located right off the highway for easy access coming and going. The room was comfortable and had all the amenities we could need. I found all the staff to be very friendly and super helpful in planning where to eat, shop and visit. I'm planning on a return visit to San Diego and am excited to stay at Crowne Plaza San Diego - Mission Valley again.

Reviews.Title: “A great reunion!”
Reviews.Author: auldbill
Reviews.Content: 20 people from all over the country met at the CP for a reunion. Everyone was well pleased with the facility, and the great staff there.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refershing...”
Reviews.Author: drbob_inTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a family wedding. The location is very good, the rooms are spacious but seem very stale and in need of updating. The staff were helpful and pleasant. I suppose the thing that summed up our stay was the fact that there was a room service tray on the floor outside the room when i checked in on Friday and on Sunday, it was still there, prompting me to call the front desk to ask if it was part of the decor. It quickly disappeared at that point. That's a sign of pretty sloppy management in a hotel in my view. The gym is quite small though reasonably equipped. It was far too warm for working out and no a/c control was in sight to adjust it, so I propped it open with a towel to let the cool air in from outside (it was in the 50's the weekend we were there). I just do not understand the concept of $12 parking at a suburban hotel with tons of space. Note to management: Just increase the rate and include it. You basically need a car to get to this property and to go anywhere once you are there. This annoyance has spread from downtown properties where parking is a problem and the fees can be justified to the 'burbs nation wide. The wedding by the way was great, but that had little to do with the hotel. This Crowne Plaza was not of the overall high standard we have experienced at other properties of this chain. New decor, beds and a general sprucing up along with some management discipline and tweaking of service could easily turn this into the 4-star and up experience that many others in the chain deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience! Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: D W
Reviews.Content: Good Morning Mr. Vinegas, I just wanted to take a moment to let you know that once again we had a wonderful experience staying at the Crowne Plaza-San Diego. We came down for our yearly trip to the Broncos/Chargers game and arrived very early in the morning on Friday, November 25th. Judy greeted us at the front desk, and could not have been more cheerful, accommodating and helpful! She was also very professional and efficient, and took care of us in an extremely welcoming manner. What a great way to start the day! When we got back from braving the Black Friday mall madness, we were thrilled to see that Susanna was still working there. We see Susanna every year when we come down, and she too is always so kind and cheerful and welcoming, and always treats us with outstanding and exceptional customer service. We look forward to seeing her every year! Sherry at the front desk, was also very friendly and helpful in pointing us in the right direction when we had some questions about how to find a nearby outlet mall and a Wal*Mart. We were sorry we missed our buddy Juan Carlos in the Islands restaurant (it was his day off on the Monday-November 28th- we went there) but Juanito gave us wonderful service and lots of laughs! So once again, the entire experience was great and we just wanted to let you know how much we enjoyed our trip and will continue to stay at the Crowne Plaza-San Diego every time we are in town! Happy Holidays to you and to all the wonderful staff at Crowne Plaza!!

Reviews.Title: “ALOHA!”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice 3 night stay at this property. Plenty of parking and they only gouge you $12/night instead of $18 a night! This place used to be called the Hanalei Hotel. Take a guess on the theme. You got it, Hawaiian. Loved the courtyards. Waterfalls, palms trees etc... If it was not 50 degrees out, I would feel as though I were on the islands.... The rooms have thick cement walls. Makes for a quiet stay (other than the drunk "guy" yelling at midnight from the courtyard.) The room was larger than normal with a decent sized bathroom. There was a a fridge and a microwave as well. Bathroom tub had built in rust on it. That was kinda gross, but overall, nice room. We had a VERY nice view overlooking some sort of lagoon and a golf course. Beautiful. WARNING: For some strange reason, the air conditioner/heater was practically right on top of the bed. We had 2 Queens in the room and the bed near the window was like sleeping next to a wind tunnel all night. No joke. On the first day, the woman cleaning our room left a trash can FULL of trash. And every night we were there, only left 1 regular coffee for the coffee maker. Obviously there should be 2 as they are single serve. And this was strange: Our first morning, she came to clean the room around 7am. Luckily we are always up early so it did not bother us much, but to hear knocks on the door at 7am was a bit "different". Other than the few small issues above, the place was great. SUPER helpful staff. One of our little guys was sick and within MINUTES they were there to help!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical landscape”
Reviews.Author: LeslieIdaho_USA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the past 6 yrs and always enjoyed it. The tropical landscape makes you feel like you are on an island somewhere. The sushi restaurant is always good and has a nice atmosphere. It offers a great happy hour and late night menu, even on Sunday. The rooms are large with nice balconies and if you stay on the golf course side you have quiet. Otherwise, the interstate is loud. Crown Plaza has added a Executive suite with free buffet breakfast for those with Priority Club level. The beaches are within a 6 min drive and easy on/off the interstate. The value is awesome and we will continue to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Clean. Nice amenities. Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Mockstew
Reviews.Content: I stayed here November 24-27, 2011 $55 per night on Priceline.com. Friendly staff upgraded my room for free. 8th floor, great view of golf course. Room appeared to be recently updated, flat screen t.v., new furniture, fridge, microwave, clean and comfortable bedding. VERY QUITE. Grounds were nice, good size pool and large spa. Workout room was adequate (2 treadmills, 2 bikes, 2 EFX machines, free weights and an all in one weight machine). The parking fee was waived and I was given a coupon for unlimited free internet for the duration of my stay. Overall this place was as nice or nicer than many Hilton's I have stayed at. I will stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation and value”
Reviews.Author: Met45
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza San Diego for 2 nights for a conference. I got the club value package which included a free breakfast and nightly drinks. A big plus was free in and out parking. The rooms were very clean, but a bit dated. The hotel restuarant was convenient and had excellent service, but the cuisine leaned towards coffee shop or cafe vs fine dining. There is an excellent steakhouse across the street, though, if that is your preference. There is also a wonderful onsite spa. The staff was excellent on all levels, and the value and personal attention more than made up for any minor detractions. The stay was a top notch value for the price, which was considerably less than others in the area. A great stay whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: hartguard
Reviews.Content: I was delighted at the pleasant stay we had at this hotel during the last week. We have stayed at this hotel before and are happy to note that it seems to be getting even better. The hotel itself, while a little old, is a pleasant tropical oasis from the hustle and bustle that is San Diego. It's like finding a little island on which to relax and unwind. The staff is marvelous and made us feel wanted and respected. The staff is friendly and courteous and anxious to please. Rates are reasonable, making it an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Girlonthego2012
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few weeks ago for work. It was really nice. Easy to get to and easy to find your way around San Diego. This hotel is not downtown, but in the Hotel Circle area. It has a fantastic sushi bar and late night happy hour. Clean and nice staff, always welcoming with a goodie bag for priority club members. Parking isn't free unless you are a PC member.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot for work travel”
Reviews.Author: learengi
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel when in town for work over a few years. I can say while its not the newest hotel, it definitely has an appeal. I've always liked interior, which looks like a rainforest with waterfalls and ponds and tikis. The staff has always been friendly and courteous, and the food in the restaurant is good. Its also nice if you get a high room with a view of the restaurant. If you are a platinum priority club member there are extra perks like free wired/wireless internet and sometimes meals. After a lond day at work you can lounge at the outdoor pool or hit the outdoor sauna. The workout room is a little small, but at least they have a few treadmills, ellipticals, and free weights (love hotels that have free weights instead of just machines). I recommend this hotel if you are in the area for work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYTripper088
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza, Hotel Circle, San Diego is a very fine hotel. The rates are decent, the rooms are clean, the staff works to please guests and the location is good. This hotel is great for Priority Club members with upgrades and other perks which make the stay so positive. This hotel is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Crowne Plaza Close to USD”
Reviews.Author: Bdbc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the CP from 9-16-9-19. Large clean room on the 7th floor overlooking the swimming pool. Two comfortable queen beds, flat screen tv, lanai with table and chairs, desk, chair and lamp area space for computer and we had wi fi no problem. Nice size bathroom, plenty of clean fluffy towels, coffee maker with coffee and tea a plus. Carpets were nice and clean too. This hotel is older but well maintained. The decor was tropical. Lots of greenery and mini waterfalls. Swimming pool temp was perfect, and the jacuzzi was large and very hot. Staff was very friendly. The hotel also offers a free shuttle to the airport and Old Town SD. I picked this hotel because it is very close to USD to attend the parent weekend. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, OK Location, Lush Landscaping”
Reviews.Author: MoJoJane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a conference after staying downtown for personal time. While the hotel is close to Old Town if you are looking for a true San Diego experience we'd suggest staying IN the city. The hotel staff were very nice and gave us a room with a beautiful view of the pool area. Navigating the hotel hallways, sidewalks and many corridors can be confusing at first but we found our way around. The restaurant was ok with friendly staff and veggie options. Parking was include and was much easier than our downtown location days earlier. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Thepenn
Reviews.Content: Elevator near room . Bell kept going off every floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: michael c
Reviews.Content: After flying all day with 3 connections due to Hurricane Irene and losing 3 days of vacation, we were pretty tired and in frustrated. When we arrived late at night the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were great and after a restful night sleep, the breakfast was just what we needed. The food was very good, hot and fresh and the wait staff was efficient and eager to serve. We stayed for 3 nights total, too bad we lost the first 2 due to the hurricane. Pool was nice along with the other amenities. The rate was was very affordable, as well as the staff prior to making the reservations. When I go back to San Diego I will definitely book here again. Thanks for being a good part of a messed up trip.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: pbansen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza while my wife attended a conference at the Town and Country just up the street. The rate was pretty good - lower than the larger properties in the area, but somewhat higher than the smaller, more "motel" properties. It's an older property, which is pretty characteristic of the hotels along this stretch of Hotel Circle - there are a a number that have been there for years - the Handlery, Town and Country, etc. Staff was very friendly and professional, the general upkeep of the property pretty good. Elevators were kind of funky and there was an atrium in the center of the building we were in which was full of a jungle of plants - this was OK, but it contributed to a sort of damp, cool feeling which is reinforced by the mostly concrete construction of the building. Our room was OK although rather dark - north facing, which may have contributed to the overall dimness, as well as being on a lower floor below the level of the trees outside the balcony. Furnishings were clean and functional but not modern by any means. Decent bed; clean, if somewhat outdated-looking bathroom. Parking was generally pretty good, although there is a gate/checkpoint that you have to activate with a room key which is kind of a nuisance. Overall, pretty good, but I'm sure there are places that have a newer feel and if that's important to you, it might make their higher rate worth the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but is in need of some T&C!”
Reviews.Author: 007solotraveler
Reviews.Content: Having read numerous poor reviews I was going to cancel my reservation but in the end didn't - after all to be a Crowne Plaza there has to be a minimum standard. It was the right decision - the hotel was much better than the reviews made out - though some of the common areas do need some T&C. I'm a Platinum PC member and was given a room upgrade to an Executive Room - the decor was great - the room was well kitted out with a microwave and fridge - really handy as was travelling with a 15 month old. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. Had use of the executive lounge with a complementry breakfast. Was also given complementary Wi-Fi and Parking . Not bad considering I had used points for the 4 night stay. Pool area was great. And the guest laundry facilities a godsend. Only draw back was some of the common areas were tired - the Tiki theme - somewhat worn. Also the restaurant was closed but the menu was available in the bar - limited but okay. I enjoyed the stay with the family and would have no hesitation in recommending it to others, Its location is great - easy access to the freeway and just a short distance to downtown San Diego - Sea World and the Zoo. Fashion Valley minutes up the road! Will stay there again next time I'm in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Coming back as soon as I can!”
Reviews.Author: Regan G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2008 to attend the FABULOUS Annual Tiki event. We were VERY appreciative of the this hotel and its staff for putting up with such a rowdy crowd - even after some boob stole a couple of the walk-way Tikis. The rooms are spacious and well-tended, the grounds are neat and tidy, the "jungle atrium" is so relaxing, the pool is refreshing and the drinks are strong! My only complaint would be the food - it's not that great and it's rather pricey. Thanks CP for putting up with our merry band of revelers and hope you can forgive the unforseen tomfoolery of the few crashers who showed up this year.

Reviews.Title: “Tiki Oasis 2011, cant wait for 2012”
Reviews.Author: Giovannianthony
Reviews.Content: My family and I had an excellent time staying at this hotel, although we came for a particuler event I would not hesitate to come back. The hotel was clean and the staff was extremely friendly. I had a little incident in the room with the vacume catching my expensive headphone cord and damaging them and the hotel had notified me before I even knew what had happended and reasured me that they would replace them, by either going out to buy the exact one or if I did and brought a reciept they would reimbuse me. The total was $161.00 and they gave me every penny without a question asked. The location is so convient to all highways and local malls and airport and beach

Reviews.Title: “One of the best times of my life”
Reviews.Author: Babylon_Drifter
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to have The Tiki Oasis - I will be back year after year - the facilities are expansive and the setting perfect for a retro holiday

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Nicer people, great location”
Reviews.Author: MWG2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and nice, although it's showing it's age. The Hanalei has been a San Diego fixture for many decades. The location is excellent as you can get to all the major San Diego freeways in no time at all. Best of all, it is a hop, skip and a jump from Old Town. (See review of La Pinata Restaurant here on Tripadvisor.) The hotel has wonderful staff who are quite helpful (typical of Crowne Plaza). There is plenty of free parking and the rooms facing north have a great view of the Mission Valley Golf Course. The rooms are clean. At night, if you are on the north side of the hotel and on the higher floors, you can watch the nighttime fireworks show at Sea World, a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lola H
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, our 3 year old and 11 month old stayed here mid August and loved it. We found the staff to be friendly and attentive, the rooms nice and big, and we loved the tropical tiki decor. The only thing we weren't that pleased with was the hotel restaurant, it was expensive for what it was, kinda gross, and the waiter was meh. The sushi bar was decent for a quick bite. There are lots of great restaurants in San Diego to choose from so I wouldn't bother eating at the hotel next time. We live in Northern Ca and come to San Diego at least once a year to visit family and I would much rather stay at a tropical oasis than at my in laws house, we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: airliner787
Reviews.Content: The room we we had was very nice, front desk service was very good any problems were solved, the restaurants food and service was good, and the hotel is in a convenient location. The only problems I have is with the extra charge for parking, & no free wi-fi (should at least have it free in the lobby and restaurants) Over all we had nice stay at this hotel. We will be coming back and staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Cation”
Reviews.Author: Joni G
Reviews.Content: We live in San Diego and stayed here..... Just a little stay-cation! All staff was super nice. Great location, pool, staff was very nice and helpful, assisted us in getting the perfect room for our needs, not a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: Zynful
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a year ago, and have had excellent service. They remembered me from the year before. The room service is very good, and housekeeping is always smiling and happy to assist with extra requests. Great location close to everything...nice bar and restaurant, and excellent Sushi bar. Will come back again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Tiki keeps us coming back”
Reviews.Author: hazmania
Reviews.Content: Great authentic Tiki decor (check the courtyards.) Sushi bar rocks (try the Hanalei Bay roll.) Staff extra attentive.

Reviews.Title: “4th year staying here for 4 days of FUN!”
Reviews.Author: monet2u
Reviews.Content: Every year I and several hundred of my friends descend upon this hotel in August for lots of fun and frolic. From the moment I check in at the front desk, I'm greeted warmly and staff even remember me from last year! Never had that before at a hotel. The bell staff are great and lug every one's stuff to their rooms (and each cart is FULL to the MAX). The rooms are clean and my calls to the front desk always answered. My event is LOUD, BUSY and I'm sure A LOT of work for the staff. They meet every demand and with kindness. Their conference rooms are have comfy chairs and come in various sizes to meet all needs. The sushi bar is tasty and it's nice have a full service restaurant and a to go coffee shop on sight. You can also got a microwave/fridge in your room if you ask. I don't often stay at Crowne Plaza hotels, but this one goes all out for their guests and I should probably stay more often!

Reviews.Title: “A Classic Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bill5925
Reviews.Content: While I stayed during a special event, this is my hotel of choice while in San Diego for any reason. The rooms are spacious and feature balconies, some of which overlook the pool area with lush, tropical vegetation. Beds are comfortable with many pillows of varying softness, so everyone should be pleased. Had several meals at hotel restaraunt and all were good. Staff was exceptionally friendly. Tropical atrium features tikis and waterfalls and is a great place to just sit and relax. Pool is warm and large. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: NealCassady001
Reviews.Content: I have attended Tiki Oasis at this hotel for the past three years. I have had a blast every time. Definitely think the venue has a lot to do with it. The views from the rooms overlooking the pool & stage area are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and excellent venue for our needs”
Reviews.Author: SLH007
Reviews.Content: I have attended a very large annual gathering/event that is held at the Crowne Plaza for many years now. The staff goes out of their way to accommodate us and make us welcome. They have gone as far as to hold my favorite room for me every year, which makes a huge difference to me. Their room service is fast and good, and they have a lovely pool area. The special feature of this hotel is the abundance of wonderful hand-carved Tiki statues, as well as a gorgeous waterfall feature. This makes this hotel unique with a tropical feeling. Perfect! I know there used to be even more Hawaiian touches here, and I hope the management brings some of that back one day, as it is so appreciated by all of us. Thank you for another enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “I Stay Here Every Time I am in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Tikitastic
Reviews.Content: I stay here every August for 5 nights during the annual Tiki Oasis event which is hosted by the Crowne Plaza Hotel San Diego - Mission Valley. I have been coming here for 5 years and am always impressed with the tropical plants on the grounds, the amazing atrium with koi pond, the excellent service and friendly staff! Plus they have a sushi bar! I plan on returning again next year. Would be great if the hotel had free parking and free WiFi like most other hotels in the area....maybe next time I stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Crowne Plaza is a great place”
Reviews.Author: marlizmarliz
Reviews.Content: Recently was at the Crown for the Tiki Oasis event. Despite the fact that the hotel was sold out, and 2000+ people were on their property, the service and quality were impeccable. The rooms are clean, service impeccable, the rooms are very clean, linens high quality, comfortable pillows (hypo allergenic available upon request), and the pool area is great! For those that want trendy high high end hotels, this may not be the place for you. If you want a great, clean, comfortable luxury hotel this is a good bet. BTW, they have a really good sushi bar on site. I personally love the tikis and what's left of the Polynesian flavor. Wish there was more because it feels like being transported to a place far far away. Great place overall.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: atillc
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump. It is old and falling apart, from the closet doors to the furniture. Don't let the entrance or lobby trick you. The rooms, towels and exterior need alot of maintenance. There are too many other hotels in the same proximity to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “HATED IT - Not work the money”
Reviews.Author: ksbonham
Reviews.Content: We had a VERY bad experience with this place. We were in town for a softball tournament and our coach recommended this place. They do not have free wi-fi or any kind of complilamentary breakfast.....most of the hotels around this one are the same cost ... same grounds but offer more for the money. The staff here was rude, and the hotel caters to their wedding guest more then the paying guests...if you stay here while their hosting wedding you will not be able to park your car...unless you concider the dirt lot on the opposite side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK resort - nice pool but rooms are old and grimey”
Reviews.Author: dave k
Reviews.Content: We prepaid for 3 nights in a king room. Arrived at midnight after a 9 hours drive and they could only give us room with 2 double beds but offered to move us in the morning. Thank goodness they offered to move us as the room with 2 double beds (#1814) was old, grimey and in desperate need of a renovation. I would not walk in the room without shoes on. Also no view balcony looked out to a cinder wall. Moved to a nicer, cleaner king room (#1831) with view overlooking huge pool that was constantly busy with tons of kids - a bit noisey but nice that they kept pool and spa opened until 11 at night. King room was spacious and cleaner than the double room but still lacks the white glove attention they should mandate. Need to remove all carpets as they were filthy and sweep the corridors regularly. Also numerous elevators around facility but were constantly used by maids - you should have a dedicated elevator for this so guests dont have to be inconvenienced and wait so long. Elevators stop at every floor every time, whether or not folks are waiting. Annoying. Parking was a joke and they charged your $12/per day. Not sure who painted the parking stall lines but they must not own a car as most folks had to take up 2 spots just to fit their cars. Most likely would not stay here again - too many numerous other resorts in San Diego area that are newly renovated in same price range. The staff folks were nice and accommodating but because we had such a crappy room upon our arrival, it was not a very good first impression.

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience”
Reviews.Author: DLPA
Reviews.Content: I did not enjoy my stay here. The good: Hotel check-in was quick enough. Lots of decent parking spaces. Bed linen and toilet were clean. Hotel Manager was polite. If you call for a staff to your room, they will definitely turn up - this was impressive considering the size of the hotel. There is a fridge and kettle available, as well as an alarm clock. The bad: Worn rooms and furniture. Spider on the ceiling and dirty leftover items under the beds - thorough cleaning is not their forte here. If TV is on, phone doesn't work. You have to switch the TV off to use the phone. Hotel's "tiki" design was extremely tacky. Hardly what I expected from a Crowne Plaza brand. Pool area was unattractive. No bell hop available - lug your own stuff to and from your room. Weird unappealing smells throughout the hotel, especially the old lift that transported us to our room everyday. No bedroom slippers - but I guess this is standard of most American hotels. Bring your own towel if you're fussy about "yellowing" towels (but they were clean and I didn't contract any skin conditions from them). The worst: 1) STOLEN PHONE Left my phone charging on the table and when I got back one hour after check-out, I found housekeeping in the room. My phone (along with charger and convertible plug) was gone. Not really sure what else to think except that they stole it, especially since there is no CCTV to the room for verification on who entered and exited with it. No one else had access to the room but the hotel since it was locked when we checked out. Hotel staff were helpful enough to help me to search the room and staff but it was likely they put it somewhere else already (remember to always keep your data roaming ON or else the Find your iPhone program won't work). Still waiting on a call from the hotel insurance company - let's see if they really follow through on this since it's the least they can do. Nothing yet and it's been a week. I don't expect my phone to be around one week later, but in the space of ONE HOUR and with the housekeeper in the room, the blatant dishonesty was appalling. 2) BAD SECURITY The lack of CCTV in the corridor was kind of worrying - if something happened to us in the room or if we found our items stolen we'd never be able to tell who it was. 3) BAD INTERNET SERVICE Wired internet was EXTREMELY SLOW. Do not expect any connectivity at this hotel. Wireless only located by the pool and at the lobby which is miles away and impractical if you're staying in Block E. I will never stay here again. There is nothing worse than dishonest staff which really reflects on the hotel's reputation.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: michaelhopper3
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place to stay. Centrally located, good reseraunt, sushi bar, large pool. Formerly the red lion inn. A little worn but still nice, hawaiian themed hotel in san diego. friendly staff. located of interstate 8 in hotel circle north.

Reviews.Title: “Service, food, rooms were terrific! We highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: shargranny
Reviews.Content: For 5 nights & 6 days we hosted a Marine reunion for 24 guys who fought in the Korean War. Their spouses, along with some children and grandchildren brought up the number to 55. The staff was extremely helpful. They were "Johnnie on the spot" for anything we needed whether it be for help hanging posters or for more ice for hospitality. The restaurant food was well prepared. The 3 catered meals were outstanding from the food to the decor. The rooms have new TVs, comfortable beds & many have small refrigerators (if you want one, ask for a room with it). Prices were very reasonable for everything - best deal in San Diego for a large group.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: tooele
Reviews.Content: First why I would stay again, location within minutes to the beach and Sea World. The staff was well above average the front desk went above and beyond to be helpful really they were great, The room cleanliness staff was also above average and friendly. I had a Tower room above the pool nice view. The Hawaiian decor is nice. Things that bothered me. Internet is not free and no wi-fi available is annoying and a complete inconvenience rooms smell of old cigarettes even though the carpet and furniture are newer this hotel should be non smoking, AC is programmed to 72 degrees which makes for hot nights. W/ a serous facelift and lots of $$$ they could charge a lot more it really has potential to be excellent and right now its good/great.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Paradise Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Da_Travel_Dude
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is very conveniently located in Hotel Circle, just minutes from major attractions and golf courses. The design of the hotel and the landscaping of the property reminded us of Hawaii, with all of the palm trees, waterfalls, Polynesian artifacts and koi fish ponds. The spacious rooms have microwave ovens and mini-fridges and their sushi bar is excellent! Their front desk staff is very fast and efficient, and all of the employees throughout the property always greet you with a friendly smile and "Good Morning" or "Good Afternoon". We will look forward to staying there whenever we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: CalifSue
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Crowne in San Diego. The rooms are nice and good size. Our room had a balcony overlooking the pool. We did not spend much time at the hotel, but the staff we met were all nice and helpful. Location is right off the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Tiki Hut”
Reviews.Author: zed1958
Reviews.Content: Okay, "hut" is not accurate. The Crowne Plaza Mission Valley is a large hotel with many rooms, but its decor is based on a Hawaiian tiki theme that seems like it's out of a 1960's beach movie. The room was clean and comfortable, but some of the furnishings were showing their age and wear. The cloth upholstery on the desk chair had tears and stains on the back. The bathroom had dual sinks. The front desk staff was pleasant and quickly checked me in using my Priority Club reservation. There is a $12/day parking fee which, given the number of other hotel chains in the immediate area, seemed out of place. The location of the hotel in Mission Valley is pretty central to most of the San Diego attractions--Old Town, Downtown, Balboa Park, San Diego Zoo, Mission Bay, Sea World. While it wasn't a horrible hotel by any stretch of the imagination, it didn't live up the Crowne Plaza standards. I'm sure that other hotel chains offered a more current, contemporary experience for a similar price. Would I return? I think I could find a better experience/value elsewhere in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on Hotel Circle”
Reviews.Author: packman8484
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza on Hotel Circle is extremely nice and a great value for your $$. I've stayed at most of the properties on the south side of the freeway and paid just as much or more for far less. The views are nice and the pool is beautiful. Great place to bring the kids. Parking is controlled and the attendents that ran the gate were some of the nicest people you ever want to meet. You are just minutes from downtown, the beach, both ballparks, and tons of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel. So-so location.”
Reviews.Author: 60750Feelfine
Reviews.Content: Good stay. Comfortable hotel. The only cons would be the charge for parking and the location. I booked this hotel through a discount service where I didn't know the hotel before I bid. I thought I got quite a good rate until I read the reviews and realized I would have to pay $12/day for parking. That turned a good rate into only an ok rate. I did not have to pay for internet since the clerk at check in comped me. I guess they have the discretion to do that. The clerk may have been nice to me because my room wasn't ready at first and I was going to have to wait an hour. I was willing to wait since it was only about noon and way before the scheduled check in time. I loved the room. Great view. On the side away from the freeway. Fridge and microwave. I'm not a fan of the hotel's location, Mission Valley. It's a rather isolated tract of hotels and a few low rent restaurants. So if you're looking for a romantic or interesting setting, consider the beach or other neighborhoods. On the other hand, you have quick access to all the major freeways in San Diego. So driving is pretty good. If you don't have a car, this place would be bad though. Stay downtown instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sonics
Reviews.Content: First off, I like the tiger rolls(sushi) and I like the way the Sashimi Flower looks. The Junior Suite I had was nicely decorated, and definitely look much improved than what it was as a Red Lion.The pool was relaxing and I felt very comfortable here. This is a good business hotel, and i like the free local shuttle service as well. The staff was business professional, so please do not change a thing there, as you have my business. Housekeepers actually talking to me- and i will be back. Although the hotel was busy, the hotel did not feel busy. This hotel is nice and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here.”
Reviews.Author: boat07
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the hotels relaxing atmosphere even though it was close to the freeway. Every effort was made to be sure we were comfortable. We would most definatley recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the San Diego area. Very Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: silverloba
Reviews.Content: We had a poolside room with a small table and chairs right outside the sliding glass door, perfect for me and my morning coffee, while my husband slept in. The room was very clean, bed comfortable, staff extremely friendly, location close to shopping, attractions, and restaurants, and a safe inside the closet. We ate at the on site restaurant, food was good, (think coffee shop, not 5 star). My husband lost a valuable watch and didn't realize it until we were halfway home, we figured he left it in the room, and it probably went home with a maid.....never to be seen again. However, I called and to our amazement it had been left in the pool area, and turned in to their lost and found. They are mailing it back to us! Wow! The downside, (very minor) were things like worn wall paper, one chair had some stains, and the $12 a day parking fee. Also if you are a coffee lover, take your own pot, they only provide the kind of single cup model with one pack each of regular and decaff. I always travel with my own, so it didn't matter to me. The little store near the lobby is tiny and closed more often than open. We found a Target nearby for the items we had forgotten, however the hotel was quick to offer a toothbrush and comb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located approximately 15 minutes from downtown San Diego. Our room was of above average size and well appointed. The bed was comfortable and the amenities in the room were of above average quality. There was a microwave and small refrigerator in the room. The Islands Restaurant serves excellent breakfasts (pricey but delicious- appx $15 per person). There is a rather large swimming pool in the hotel; however, we did not use it as it was chilly outside (50 degrees). Parking is $12 per day for guest and Internet Service is $9.99 per day. Although we were not happy to pay for parking, we would defintely stay there again when we return to that area. We were able to use our cellphones (blackberry's modem to connect to the internet without problems).

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS - a vintage paradise!”
Reviews.Author: dolldetails
Reviews.Content: We travel quite a bit, and have stayed at most of the hotels in Mission Valley. This place reminded me of what California use to be when I was young. Rolling hills, sunshine, relaxed atmosphere. It was a treat to see a pretty view and forget that I was in a big city. If you get sick of the sterile Marriott/Sheraton/Doubletree circut with the cookie-cutter everything and want something more retro, this is the place. The waterfall was amazing I thought I was at Disneyland or Costa Rica. If you stay there, ask for a room with the view, or ask to hear the waterfall. We stayed in 1607 and you can see the pictures I posted from the balcony. The food was great. The buffet part of the breakfast was a joke, so I ordered off the menu, even if it was about $5.00 extra. Also a tip is they will loan you a key card for the business center so you don't have to pay. Parking is extra money... Easy to get on an off the freeway. It is at hotel circle north, so you will need a car. Don't think you will walk from your hotel to the beach, or convention center. Staff was really nice. This and the double tree fashion valley are the best properties in Mission Valley area. I will for sure be back! Make sure to get the coconut creme brulee. It was the best ever and I have been to France twice. The best part was we only paid $62 a night for Valentines weekend off of the Negotiating-line website... Those avid travelers know which one I am talking about!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: JulesOZBrisbane
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights with my teenage sons (17 & 19). This hotel was recommended to me and it lived up to my expectations. The location is excellent and central -- everywhere I wanted to go was within 15 minutes. The staff are friendly and helpful and the restaurant was great. Though it is right by the freeway I would never have known - we were on the 6th floor with a golf-course and almost rural view. Nothing was a problem and any requests were dealt with quickly and efficiently. I will definitely return if I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RayanKsa
Reviews.Content: Not what we have expected in terms of service. some of the staff were rude, & the rooms were way overpriced for their standards, plus why the hell would they charge us $12 a day for parikng? even motels provide free parkng for their guests. You'll have to pay for Internet too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: hangglidin_mama
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the November 2010 review, our experience was wonderful. At check-in, we were greeted by friendly staff, who accomodated our early check-in & family needs (frig/micro/crib if we'd wanted one.) Our room was beautiful, with a view of the pool and garden. We made great use of the jacuzzi, and for the business portion of my stay, it was convenient to walk to the conference center and I had wired access in the room (free for AT&T customers) as well as wireless at the conference. Parking was free with my Priority Rewards membership (also free.) San Diego in general is not overwhelmingly large -- Balboa Park and La Jolla cafes/beaches were all an easy drive. I would certainly return again!

Reviews.Title: “Really?”
Reviews.Author: ananda
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, to tour a nearby college. The room itself was fine. Ample size, clean enough. But $12 simply to self-park overnight? Really? No wireless? Really? $9.95 (+ taxes) to access the internet at all? Really? Plus, the outdoor hallways were gross, lined with water-stained outdoor carpet, there was a light so bright on the deck that it illuminated the room even with the blackout shades closed, and there was someone nearby who chainsmoked all night, precluding us from keeping our door open. I realize this smoke issue isn't the hotel's, but it was nasty. All in all, I just kept saying, "Really?"

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, but not in walking distance to anything”
Reviews.Author: MediaProf
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights while attending a conference. The hotel has a distinct 'Hawaiian' theme to it (e.g., the meeting room names, the restaurant, the decor, etc), which felt rather dated but was kind of kitschy nonetheless. The room was of a good size with a comfortable bed, typical sized bathroom, nightly fee for internet, etc. The meeting rooms in the main building were up to snuff, though those rooms located at the small annex on the other side of the parking lot were small and stuffy. The main restaurant was nothing special, although passable enough; the sushi bar had mixed reviews from those I spoke with, but I enjoyed one of the appetizers myself. The pool was of good size, too. Location-wise, do note if staying here that you are not downtown; it is located on Hotel Circle in Mission Valley, about a 10-15 minute drive from the airport. It's a quick drive (5 mins) to Old Town, and cabs come fairly quickly, so it isn't too much of an issue if you are there for a conference. But if staying on vacation, especially with kids, there are better options just based on location. Overall, it's not a bad hotel, it just depends on what your reason for staying there is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Edd60
Reviews.Content: we had 3 nights here our room was on the ground floor facing the atrium&gardens the room was a good size and quite modern,clean and tidy with 2 comfortable queen beds tv,coffee maker, alarm clock, iron and board and hairdryer. it has nice pool and hot tub although we didnt use them We had a couple of meals in the resturant food was good but notthing outstanding and seemed a little expensive to me,cant comment on the sushi bar as we didnt use it All staff both pleasant and helpful we used the free shuttle bus to the old town a couple of times again no problems,all in all a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “The Stay here was HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: latrell40
Reviews.Content: Planned a trip to San Diego for 4 days 3 nights-made reservations over the phone rep very nice and everything that we asked was advised would be available--shuttle service; internet etc. When we arrived at the airport found out that the shuttle does not run for individuals only for flight crew that has a contract with the hotel. Ended up having to take a cab to the hotel for 25.00. The hotel is not close to anything and the shuttle will only take you with in a 3 mile radius once you arrive there. The rooms were OK -However Hotel smells of Sushi and like mildew and the food sucked. For the price this is not worth it. Our 3 day stay turned into one day and we ended up moving to the Holiday Inn on the Bay which was really nice had shuttle service for all of their guest and the food was great! And the view of the bay was awesome and everything was in walking distance. I would not recommend Crowne Plaza it is an old hotel that is not worth the price. There was also a Marine Reunion going on and these fellows stayed up and were very loud! The pool side as they call it also faces the busy freeway and is very noisy. Do not book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: ReenyW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two friends stayed here for two nights as the first stop on a two week tour. We could not have had a better first hotel.The room was clean and the beds very comfortable. It had a lovely landscaped garden and pool area too but the best asset was the friendly and helpful staff. We were made to feel very welcome and we used the restaurant both for an evening meal and breakfast. The service for both of these was excellent. Thank you Jose Carlos and staff for this. We can't quite understand the bad reports on this site - no one else on the coach had any problems either.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great, very helpful and super friendly.”
Reviews.Author: DentownTraveller
Reviews.Content: We came out for the annual Tiki Oasis weekend with a group of friends. Everyone had a total blast. Hotel staff was super helpful, friendly and knowledgable. The hotel was clean, the rooms big and pretty nice overall. The hotel shuttle was a very helpful feature. The only downside was one of teh two queen beds in our room was at the end of its life, not too bad but not great at all. The other bed was fine. The location of the hotel was really nice too, 5 minutes to old town and just a few miles to Sea World and other great San Diego attractions. At the end of the trip I picked up on a discrepancy on our bill, they handled the issue right away, professionally and courteously. We'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “it is a nightmare , big mistake to stay in Crowne plaza.”
Reviews.Author: Joez007
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. there are bed bugs in the bed. My wife got sick due to the bug bytes. She had to see a doctor at an Urgent care center. she got prescription drugs to treat the illness. Spent $175 to see the doctor, and spent much more to get the medicine. It is a nightmare , should have stayed in another hotel. We talked to the hotel managers. they did incident report to their insurance. However the insurance company did not pay a cent. They denied that it is the hotel problem. Currently, I am looking for Lawyers to sue the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “our stay at Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyBD
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego in June/July of 2010. We had an amazing stay at the Crowne Plaza. The people were so helpful and accomodating! They recommened great restaurants and things to do and were great about getting us there!

Reviews.Title: “If you have a choice do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: nema1961
Reviews.Content: We attended a function over the weekend where this hotel is the venue so we were force to stay here. Big mistake. Staff is rude, impolite, not helpful, does not know the meaning of customer service, food is terrible, hotel guest are charged daily parking, use of internet; facilities like swimming pool, fitness center sucks (dirty and it smells); when inside the room - you can hear everything from the outside. Is this really a Crowne Plaza Hotel? If it is I will never stay at any CP hotel in any part of the world ....

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: larrlar2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 7-nights in June. We really enjoyed the stay, the hotel fit our needs. Although it was not within walking distance of anything, it was a short drive to all the major kids attractions. The hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful with all of our requests and fixed a couple items very quickly. The two main problems were the doors and the food at the restaurant. The doors would slam if you didn't stop them, I was woken up by the noise a couple of times during our stay. The food at the Island restaurant was terrible, we ordered the pizza the afternoon we arrived and it was basically inedible. My wife and kids ate one afternoon and my wife thought it was terrible. Luckily there are plenty of other options within a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, Great Sushi”
Reviews.Author: pagan66
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value. The location is good and the rooms are nice. Looking at other hotels and their prices we were very happy with this place. Nothing fancy but clean and comfortable rooms. The sushi bar is the best in the area. The only bad experience was "The Islands" restaurant---just avoid it. The food was poor and the service poor.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, peaceful, cool and elegant hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: PRATHAPA
Reviews.Content: I stayed for for 4 days for conference in near by venue. Nice hotel with landscaped garden, very impressive. large fitness center and pool, I enjoyed stay , as if I was doing my routine gym and other activities , at home. Hotel is clean and cooperative staff. Liked the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Awkward Location”
Reviews.Author: traveler5587
Reviews.Content: Completely loved my stay. Even though right next to the freeway, the view outside of the room was spectacular. Ask for a room that over looks the pool. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The only things I disliked were 1) you had to pay for parking 2) you had to pay for internet 3) everything that we wanted to go to was on the other side of the Freeway...you had to drive if you wanted to go somewhere BUT this is true for all the hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel - just don't pay too much!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingOlive
Reviews.Content: We drove to San Diego for a quick weekend trip to Sea World. Knowing that hotel circle is just a few minutes from Sea World, the location suited us just fine. We have an affinity for the Holiday Inn Express group, etc but it was so last minute that the ones closer in town were booked We have never stayed at a Crowne Plaza before, and the pictures of the property looked great - so we decided to give it a try. The pictures don't lie - it really IS a beautiful property. Our room was in one of the best locations. The room faced south looking down at the pool area, while the front door of our room led to an outdoor hallway looking down at the gorgeous atrium area. The walkout balcony was large and had a table and chair set. So those are the pros. The cons: -When booking the room I looked on the website and saw there was a microwave and mini fridge, However, when we got to our room, there was NO such appliance. As we had intended to keep our cooler contents in the fridge, and perhaps make breakfast in the morning, this was not good. We try to make these weekend trips on a budget and eating out every meal is not an option. Apparently, upon review of the website later, only *some* rooms have these appurtenances. -Room was musty, and smelled of smoke from years past (not recent) Then again, we're from the desert, and humidity generally smells musty to us! :) -Bathroom, while clean, definitely needed some work. Tile / gyp board was lifting up from past water stains, etc. Grout was very old. Rust stains in tub, etc. The things you usually see in older hotels that haven't been completely gutted in last twenty years. So, it's an OK hotel. If you need a fridge, ask for one - not all rooms apparently have them. The beautiful grounds and wonderful pool almost made up for the so-so guest room. Almost. Just don't pay more than you would for a midlevel hotel. One note: The parking. I saw several complaints in the previous reviews concerning the small size of the parking lot & spaces. They're not that small. They're normal for a larger compacted urban area. If you're trying to get a huge Escalade in one, then maybe you'll have trouble. Minivan size or less - no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy_ur_travel
Reviews.Content: Its a great place to stay with friends and family as well. The staff is helpful .Has shuttle service to San Diego zoo and Sea World..

Reviews.Title: “After a long day at work or play don't expect this hotel's front desk to care about you.”
Reviews.Author: traveler444_10
Reviews.Content: We had 18 family members staying here for 7 nights. This was a very important family reunion that had been booked for 9 months with ages ranging from 2years to 90. A number of us had to have our rooms moved again and again. Several rooms that were labeled non-smoking reeked so bad you couldn't even walk into the room. We later found out the rooms had been designated non-smoking over a year ago, but they have never cleaned the drapes or repainted. Then there was the night that despite being booked on the "quiet wing" there were young teenagers on either side of us running and screaming in the halls and splashing in the pool til midnight. The response from the front desk was "not our problem". The front desk day and night employees and managers constantly were caught in lies over the 7 days. From saying one of our rooms was receiving complaints at 2am (they were asleep) despite the fact they admitted to hearing no noise coming from the room, to saying there was no airport shuttle after we called for a cab and found out there was an airport shuttle, to asking for directions around town and the desk saying they were too busy to oblige. The customer service was Horrible. Everything seemed like a huge effort to them and they never offered to make the stay better. The hot tub was broken, the fitness center smelled and had no air circulation, parking was $12 a DAY and internet $10 a DAY. The meals and bar were EXTREMELY overpriced. This is a wannabe 4star hotel without the service, manners or etiquette to truly be so.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, AWESOME,HELPFUL Staff, Clean Pool, and good food”
Reviews.Author: VagabondGirl_plusOne
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for Crowne Plaza, and honestly had my doubts when i read previous review before going. I went with my son, and LOVED this place. Yes this place has a 60s kind of vibe, but the customer service was awesome. I had a little trrouble with my room key, and they fixed the problem right away. they even recommended things for me and my son to do. My son loved the pool, and I loved the peaceful atmosphere.Also, the breakfast was excellent. The besy part of thr trip, was the sleep I got. The beds exceeded my expectations! I was surrised ti find I fell asleep right away, especially since I have insomnia, and back problems. the Crowne Plaza definitely will be the place I will stay time and time again!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be mistaken.... This is not Crowne Plaza Quality”
Reviews.Author: excelden
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family stayed at this "motel style" Crowne Plaza for a family vacation. I picked this hotel based on location mostly, and although it is a clean hotel and the rooms were clean and comfortable, I can not say that this is what I have learned to expect from a typical Crowne Plaza. Please keep in mind if you are going to stay here that this property is a privately held hotel that used to be a Red Lion Hotel and shows it's age. It has had a "soft make over" with worn mirrors in the room and ceiling that look like they"ve had spotty repairs done to them. I am also a priority club member and asked John at the front desk for a later courtesy check out - due to a late flight out and at first he said "no" because he said that the hotel was sold out and they needed us out to clean the room on time. Now all I asked for was maybe till 2 o' clock and after some thought he extended it to 1 o'clock. I later found out that some other person wanted to get a room for that night and had no problem buying a room! So I asked John why he told me he was sold out when he was clearly not, he then proceeded to tell me that they were 97% sold out! All I was asking for was a small courtesy.... By the way he also stated that if I was not out of the room by 1pm that I would be charged for a 1/2 day... nice. I think the owners of this hotel have to remember that hotel industry in this area is very competitive and some flexibility would go a long way. If you are in this area choose another hotel there is a brand new Marriott Courtyard Inn just down the street I'm sorry that I did not book with them I will next time though! Do yourself a favour and choose another hotel. Hotels within the North or South hotel circle are close to shopping, old town, Seaworld and San Diego Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “I really like the 60's hawaiian vibe.”
Reviews.Author: northernaurora
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Crown Plaza. It's an older building, but the rooms are clean and comfortable. The outdoor court yard, pool, and the sushi bar are my favorite things. The hotel has a shuttle that will take you to Old town and the Fashion Mall. If you want to go anywhere else you are on your own. There is no place close enough to walk too (don't bother with the steak house two blocks away). The staff was helpfull about finding other transportation arrangments. I made the mistake of taking a shuttel from the airport, only to find out it would have been cheaper, safer, and faster to take a cab).

Reviews.Title: “Great Service And Nice Rooms Needs To Be Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: nancinmofo
Reviews.Content: A pretty nice hotel with friendly staff. Once again it needs to be remodeled. The restaurant is good and priced right. I satyed there for two nights and paid $60 through Hotwire. I wouldnt pay over $80 for a room there.

Reviews.Title: “Service - what service”
Reviews.Author: BugsTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and all 4 nights I asked for coffee. They give you a coffee maker that makes ONE cup of coffee, and they give you ONE cup of coffee. Never did they bring more coffee to our room, and of course down stairs it was for charge…. Next time I will stay at the day’s inn next door. OH! The $120 per night did not include the $12 parking fee, and they did not have a shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: aykan
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego having travelled for 25 hours only to find that our pre-booked hotel, The Handlery, was closed for refurbishment. Nobody had bothered to tell us or our travel agent. However, our very helpful taxi driver took us to the next hotel, the Crown Plaza, which happened, by sheer luck, to be expecting us. They were accepting all Handlery bookings. The Crown Plaza was excellent. The room spacious and clean. Food was good and inexpensive and the free courtesy bus to the Old Town was a bonus. We used the pool area although didn;t venture into the pool as it was a little chilly. The only downside was the noise from other guests who decided it was a good idea to use the pool in the middle of the night and make a lot of noise. However, a quick call to Reception and Security soon put a stop to that. All in all it was a very pleasant surprise to find such a good hotel by chance. I would definitely recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay in this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: BadH2O
Reviews.Content: At hotel circle in San Diego one doesn't necessarily expect resort quality. However the Crowne Plaza was a big disappointment. I am a frequent traveler in their loyalty program however for checking in early I was punished with one of three rooms off the parking lot facing the freeway. The hotel wasn't close to full, by the way. As I arrived the front desk supervisor was`being quite uncooperative and almost rude to the wife of our keynote speaker who needed an hour to extend her checkout. The restaurants are more expensive than they should be for so-so food. I travel a lot on business so I know the difference. Not characteristic of most Crowne Plazas; I will stay elsewhere next time. (Oh, and 35 cents a minute to print a boarding pass????????)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: semperfiguy59
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many times (more than 10)athis hotel over the years and keep going back. It is a shot drive to most the attractions and the staff always gives good directions. They have even recommended a good restaurant that wasn't theirs. When we left a birthday present in our room after checking out they fetched it for us without a squabble, We have stayed at other area hotels from time to time but always return to the Crowne Plaza due to their superior service and excellent staff especially at the front desk. I do wish they had free internet and parking but they way they make you feel here makes up for these inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JudiL4
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. Extremely easy to get anywhere you need to go.Close to airport, zoo, beaches, Old Town, etc. Very nice nice rooms w/balconies, clean, nice pool area, good restaurant and great lounge/sushi bar. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good amenities, but GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaAl
Reviews.Content: In addition to the usual niceties of a middle range hotel, this place distinguished itself with service. We left the interior light on in our rental car by accident, and somebody noticed it.
